description: South Korea plans to bolster its fiscal support for domestic chipmakers next year, shoring up an industry that may face unfavorable policies from the incoming Trump administration and more intense challenges from Chinese rivals.
title: South Korea Eyes $10 Billion in Support for Chipmakers in 2025

description: Peru’s Congress on Tuesday fired the energy and mines minister over a bill the government had introduced to increase oversight on informal miners that had prompted nationwide protests.
title: Peru Congress Fires Mining Minister Over Bill to Curb Informal Mines

description: Good morning, it’s Georgie here in Sydney. Here’s all the news you need to start your day.Today’s must-reads:• Tech giants slam under-16 social media ban• Macquarie fined by UK• Trump’s tariff threat on Mexico, Canada and China
title: Social Media Behemoths Slam Proposed Ban

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, international economics and security reporterEric Martin looks at how Trump deploys tariff threats. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Wastes No Time in Pulling Out the Tariff Card

description: If President-elect Donald Trump’s first-term playbook is any guide, his latest threat to slap tariffs on major US trading partners is the start of negotiations rather than the end.
title: Trump’s Latest Tariff Threat Is Straight From His First-Term Playbook

description: Three suspects accused of murdering an Israeli-Moldovan rabbi in the United Arab Emirates were apprehended in Istanbul over the weekend during a covert operation by Turkey’s National Intelligence Organization and police.
title: Turkey Captured Suspects in Israeli Rabbi’s Murder, Anadolu Says

description: Donald Trump’s transition team has signed a long-awaited agreement with President Joe Biden’s administration to begin the formal process of bringing the president-elect’s nominees into federal government agencies.
title: Trump Team Signs Transition Agreement With Biden Administration

description: President Joe Biden said Israel reached a cease-fire deal with the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah after weeks of talks mediated by the US, and hailed the agreement as a major step to ending a conflict that’s killed thousands of people.
title: Biden Says Israel and Hezbollah Reach Cease-Fire Agreement

description: Pakistan’s government has launched a crackdown and arrested several protesters of former prime minister Imran Khan’s party that started a sit-in in Islamabad to demand his release from jail, according to the opposition political party.
title: Imran Khan Party Says Crackdown Started on Protest in Islamabad

description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier said the country faces a “storm” in financial markets if an “unlikely but possible” alliance of lawmakers across the political spectrum rejects his government’s budget proposals and votes it out of power.
title: French Premier Warns of Market ‘Storm’ If Budget Voted Down

description: President-elect Donald Trump is said to have selected Kevin Hassett to lead the National Economic Council, a role spearheading the new administration’s tax, trade and spending agenda, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump to Name Hassett National Economic Council Chief

description: Tom Homan, Donald Trump’s pick for border czar, vowed to unleash a sweeping crackdown on illegal immigration and escalate enforcement along the southern border with Mexico.
title: Incoming Trump Border Czar Homan Promises Mass Deportation Ahead in Visit to Texas

description: Zimbabwe failed to pay state workers the ZiG component of their salaries and bonuses in November, less than two weeks after its Treasury requested spending cuts on certain budget items.
title: Zimbabwe Fails to Pay State Workers’ ZiG Wages, Union Says

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he will bring a proposed cease-fire with the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah to a vote in Israel’s security cabinet Tuesday night, potentially paving the way for an end to a war that’s killed thousands of people and forced more than a million to flee their homes.
title: Netanyahu Says War Cabinet to Vote on a Lebanon Cease-Fire Plan

description: Chile’s government is willing to withdraw a measure that would have eaten into profits for a segment of the renewable energy industry, but is pledging to review the rules for small electricity generators at a later date.
title: Chile’s Energy Chief Willing to Delay Contentious Pricing Change

description: Romanian Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu called for an investigation into a campaign of his pro-Russian ultranationalist opponent following his shock defeat in the first round of the country’s presidential election.
title: Romanian Premier Vows to Probe Rival’s TikTok Election Campaign

description: Canadian Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland was wrapping up a meeting of a special cabinet group on US relations on Monday evening in Ottawa when a fresh crisis emerged: Donald Trump made a tariff threat on social media.
title: Trump Tariff Shock Sparks All-Hands Response in Trudeau War Room

description: Kenyan lawmakers called for an investigation into how independent power producers set tariffs as part of a study into how the East African nation’s over-reliance on private generation facilities affects the cost of electricity.
title: Kenyan Lawmakers Demand Probe of Independent Power Producers

description: Former hedge fund manager Whitney Tilson plans to run for New York City mayor, joining a crowded field of Democrats seeking to succeed the embattled Eric Adams next year.
title: Ex-Hedge Fund Manager Whitney Tilson Will Run for NYC Mayor

description: Saudi Arabia outlined plans to trim spending in 2025 after overshooting targets this year in an effort to progress a trillion-dollar economic transformation plan.
title: Saudi Arabia Plans to Cut Spending While Diversifying Economy

description: President Claudia Sheinbaum suggested Mexico could respond to Donald Trump’s threatened tariffs with levies of its own, warning the economic consequences would be dire.
title: Mexico Hints at Retaliation After Trump Threatens Steep Tariffs

description: Russia’s Defense Ministry said its forces were preparing a response to Ukraine’s recent attacks using US-supplied ATACMS missiles on air defense units in the Kursk border region.
title: Russia Warns of Response as Ukraine Strikes With US Missiles

description: Israel began heavy strikes on Beirut on Tuesday, hours before a cabinet vote over whether to accept a cease-fire with Lebanon-based Hezbollah.
title: Israel Bombs Beirut as Netanyahu Seeks Cabinet Backing for Truce

description: As Elon Musk prepares to wield more power in Washington, the state where he built his fortune is girding for a fight.
title: California’s Newsom Sets Himself Up as a Foil to Musk and Trump

description: Keir Starmer’s government set out plans to get more Britons back into work, spur economic growth and reduce the welfare bill, but the prime minister risked further accusations of indecision by putting off the most contentious decisions.
title: Labour Back-to-Work Plan Puts Off the Hardest Calls to Next Year

description: The European Union will impose a stricter fiscal path on the Netherlands, forcing it to limit its spending more aggressively after the traditionally financially disciplined country ignored recommendations from the bloc’s executive arm.
title: EU to Force Fiscal Path on the Netherlands to Balance Its Budget

description: A US Senate investigative panel blasted airlines for increasingly charging so-called “junk fees” to help boost their bottom lines, saying the practice has increased costs and complexity for consumers.
title: US Senate Panel Slams Airlines for ‘Junk Fees’ in Latest Probe

description: Russia expelled a British diplomat, accusing him of providing false information on his entry application and conducting intelligence activities.
title: Russia to Expel UK Diplomat for Providing False Information

description: The UK spending watchdog has refused to sign off on the government’s annual accounts for the first time ever, pointing to a huge backlog of councils needing to get their finances audited.
title: UK Spending Watchdog Refuses to Sign Off Government Accounts

description: Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo will not seek a third term in office, setting in motion a succession battle for the coveted job that has historically served as a springboard for the presidency.
title: Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo Won’t Seek Reelection in 2026

description: Slovakia’s ruling coalition now controls only a razor thin majority in parliament, a development that may complicate governance for Prime Minister Robert Fico over the rest of his term.
title: Slovak Premier Faces Trouble as His Majority in Parliament Thins

description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson has five weeks to pass a budget that fills the city’s nearly $1 billion deficit. Time is short, and so is the money.
title: Chicago Mayor Struggles to Find Revenue for Debt-Ridden City

description: A Spanish law enforcement agency is seeking to investigate the chief prosecutor amid a political scandal involving press leaks and both the national and Madrid regional governments.
title: Top Spanish Prosecutor Faces Criminal Investigation

description: Donald Trump’s administration will likely support global immunization efforts, even though his proposed secretary of health and human services has voiced skepticism about such initiatives, according to the head of an organization that helps to vaccinate more than half of the world’s children.
title: Vaccine Head Sees Scope for Support Despite Trump’s RFK Jr. Pick

description: The energized Venezuelan opposition movement that could have unseated Nicolás Maduro in this year’s presidential election has scattered to the wind.
title: Maduro Purges Rivals From Venezuela With Wave of Repression

description: Bluesky said it’s working to comply with European Union rules after the bloc accused the fast-growing social media platform of flouting its digital regulations.
title: Bluesky Says It Will Comply With EU Rules After Being Called Out

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Donald Trump’s Tariffs Curveball Is Just the Start

description: Egyptian authorities on Tuesday recovered the bodies of three of the 16 people missing after a tourist boat sank in the Red Sea a day earlier, a government official said.
title: Egypt Recovers Bodies of 3 Tourists Missing After Boat Sinks

description: The Biden administration is proposing a rule that would require the US government to cover weight-loss drugs, potentially expanding access for millions of Americans with obesity and creating a huge new medical bill for President-elect Donald Trump.
title: Biden Proposes Medicare, Medicaid Coverage of Obesity Drugs

description: The German economy will need hundreds of thousands of immigrants a year to counter the negative impact from its aging society, according to a new study that feeds into an increasingly heated debate on the matter.
title: German Economy Needs 288,000 Migrants a Year, New Study Shows

description: France’s central bank governor, Francois Villeroy de Galhau, called for more certainty around plans to repair the country’s finances as the government struggles to get the budget through parliament.
title: French Central Bank Chief Urges Clarity as Budget Doubts Persist

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban may announce his choices for central bank governor and a powerful economy czar in days, according to a senior minister, with finance chief Mihaly Varga the front-runner to take charge of monetary policy.
title: Hungary’s Orban Poised to Pick New Central Bank Chief in Days

description: Georgia’s parliament set Dec. 14 as the date for selecting a new president, as lawmakers continue to meet despite an opposition boycott over the results of last month’s elections.
title: Georgia to Elect President on Dec. 14 as Lawmakers Defy Boycott

description: Turkey is in talks with the US over a sanctions waiver that would allow the country to keep using Russia’s Gazprombank to pay for natural gas imports.
title: Turkey Seeks US Sanctions Waiver to Continue Russia Gas Payments

description: Donald Trump fired an opening shot in his tariff battle with Beijing by promising an additional 10% levy on Chinese goods. The question that now confronts President Xi Jinping is how much more is coming.
title: Trump Tests Xi’s Appetite to Play Ball With Early Tariff Threat

description: Israel’s government is confident the economy, strained by wars in Gaza and Lebanon, will rebound strongly next year as fighting eases.
title: Israel’s Government Confident Worst Is Over for War-Hit Economy

description: France is eying investments in strategic companies and conducting a review of its corporate assets, the country’s finance minister told Les Echos newspaper just after the government offered to buy Atos SE’s advanced computing business.
title: French Government Reviews Corporate Assets, Mulls Investments

description: The Shinawatra clan that has dominated Thailand’s politics for the past two decades made a return to power in August — and it didn’t take long for opponents to emerge with moves to oust it from government. Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra runs an uneasy coalition that is pressing ahead with cash stimulus worth billions of dollars to bolster the economy, which risks adding to the country’s pile of debt. The prime minister, her billionaire father Thaksin Shinawatra who used be Thailand’s prem
title: Thailand’s Top Political Dynasty Faces New Threats to Power: What to Know

description: The Philippines’ National Bureau of Investigation on Tuesday issued a subpoena to Vice President Sara Duterte, days after saying she had made arrangements for the assassination of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
title: Philippines Investigates VP Duterte Over Threat to Kill Marcos

description: Exports are at their lowest in two months after slipping for the fourth time in five weeks
title: Russia’s Seaborne Crude Exports Fall by the Most Since July

description: Polls show a tight race as leader Simon Harris fights to stay in power
title: Ireland’s Tax Windfall Drives Huge Election Spending Promises

description: Namibia, which is gearing up to become a major oil and gas producer, holds elections on Wednesday that have been billed as the most hotly contested in the arid southern African nation since it gained independence in 1990.
title: Disenchanted Namibians Vote as Nation Gears Up for Oil Boom

description: Czech intelligence chief Michal Koudelka has spent decades uncovering Russian spy networks, sabotage attempts and disinformation campaigns against Europe.
title: Top Czech Spy Warns NATO Against Pushing Bad Peace in Ukraine

description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte called on the military to protect the Constitution and correct what he described as a “fractured governance,” but stopped short of calling for a coup.
title: Duterte Urges Military to Correct Marcos’ ‘Fractured’ Governance

description: Mexico’s finance ministry is preparing to enlist a consortium of banks to provide financing that Petroleos Mexicanos would use to pay off debt with service providers, according to a recording of remarks made by its CEO.
title: Pemex to Work With Finance Ministry on Debt Plan for Suppliers

description: Hong Kong has become a center for financial crimes as Beijing tightened its grip on the city, US lawmakers said, highlighting the worsening ties between the former British colony and Washington.
title: Hong Kong a ‘Global Leader’ in Financial Crime, US Lawmakers Say

description: President-elect Donald Trump named James Braid, a top aide to running mate JD Vance, as the leader of the White House’s legislative affairs shop as the leadership of the incoming administration’s political operation took shape on Monday.
title: Trump Picks Vance Aide James Braid to Run Legislative Affairs
